intro: Cryptotaenia japonica f. warabiana, commonly known as Japanese warabina, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its habitat includes moist, shaded areas such as forests and streambanks. It is valued in traditional Japanese gardens for its ornamental appearance and aromatic foliage.
